page.title: 14Politics-Biography
page.content: Richard Caborn, M.P.,(Labour) Sheffield Central Division.Lives on Quarry Vale Rd with his wife Margaret and their two children, Steven and Catherine.He was educated at Hurlfield Comprehensive school,Granville College and Sheffield Polytechnic.In 1959 was apprentice of the year and later became convenor for the AUEW at Firth Browns.He has held the following positions: ,member of the BBC Northern Advisory committee,chairman of the Sheffield district labour party,vice-president of the Sheffield trades council,member of the European parliament from 1979-1983,chairman of the British labour group of MEPs in Strasbourg.Elected M.P for Sheffield central in 1983. Family background is one of involvement in local politics and union activity.
